about.heading: About Me
about.bio: I am a Data Scientist and Machine Learning Engineer with a PhD in Artificial Intelligence & Robotics from Stevens Institute of Technology (Graduated June 2024). My research integrates cutting-edge Machine Learning, Computer Vision, and Robotics expertise to develop self-aware autonomous systems for smart manufacturing, aligned with Industry 4.0 principles. With 6+ years of hands-on experience across academic research and industry applications, I have developed advanced AI models for real-time quality control, anomaly detection, and process optimization in additive manufacturing. My work has resulted in multiple peer-reviewed publications, patent-pending innovations, and significant improvements in manufacturing efficiency and reliability.

projects.title: Vision-Transformer-Based Real-Time Motion Tracking System
projects.description: Engineered a state-of-the-art Vision-Transformer algorithm for interpreting acoustic emission data from robotic manipulator heads in additive manufacturing. This groundbreaking system achieves real-time tracking with ±0.1 mm accuracy, enabling precise monitoring of the manufacturing process. The solution leverages transformer architectures to process complex sensor data and extract meaningful motion patterns, significantly advancing the field of autonomous manufacturing monitoring. Published in MSEC 2024.

projects.title: Binocular Deep Learning Model for Dual-Wavelength Imaging Pyrometry
projects.description: Developed an innovative deep learning solution for online temperature analysis using dual-wavelength imaging pyrometry in additive manufacturing. This binocular model processes thermal data from multiple wavelengths simultaneously to provide highly accurate real-time temperature measurements, critical for quality control in metal additive manufacturing. The system enables precise thermal monitoring without physical contact, advancing non-invasive quality assessment techniques. Published in JIMS 2024.

projects.title: TDIP: Tunable Deep Image Processing for Real-Time Melt Pool Monitoring
projects.description: Developed TDIP, a revolutionary tunable deep image processing framework for real-time melt pool monitoring in additive manufacturing. This system optimized TensorFlow deep learning models to reduce melt pool image processing time from 120 seconds to under 1 second—a remarkable 120× performance improvement. The solution enables instantaneous quality assessment during the manufacturing process, allowing for immediate corrective actions and significantly reducing defect rates. Published in IPCV 2023.

projects.title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Autonomous Defect Detection and Mitigation System
projects.description: Designed and implemented a groundbreaking Reinforcement Learning-based controller for real-time anomaly detection and fault mitigation in additive manufacturing (Patent Pending). This autonomous system learns optimal control strategies to detect defects during the manufacturing process and automatically adjusts process parameters to prevent quality issues. The controller demonstrates the practical application of RL in industrial settings, achieving 98% anomaly detection accuracy while maintaining manufacturing throughput.

projects.title: Point Cloud-Based Quality Assessment Using Hybrid Convolutional Autoencoder-Decoders
projects.description: Developed an advanced deep learning solution using Hybrid Convolutional Autoencoder-Decoders for feature extraction from point cloud and image data in additive manufacturing. This system achieves 98% accuracy in autonomous anomaly detection by learning compressed representations of complex 3D manufacturing data. The solution addresses the challenge of processing high-dimensional point cloud data in real-time, enabling continuous quality monitoring without human intervention. Published in JIMS 2023 and ASME-MSEC 2023.

projects.title: In-Situ Laser-Based Process Monitoring with Machine Learning
projects.description: Implemented a comprehensive machine learning solution for in-plane surface anomaly identification in additive manufacturing using laser-based monitoring and point cloud data. This system combines advanced sensor technology with ML algorithms to detect surface defects during the manufacturing process, enabling immediate quality assessment. The approach provides non-contact, high-resolution monitoring capabilities that outperform traditional quality control methods. Published in ASME-IDETC&CIE 2021.

projects.title: Publicly Accessible Image-Based Dataset for Additive Manufacturing ML
projects.description: Created and published a comprehensive image-based dataset of artifact surfaces fabricated by additive manufacturing, specifically designed for machine learning applications. This publicly accessible database includes thousands of high-quality images with detailed annotations, facilitating research and development in smart manufacturing. The dataset has been adopted by researchers worldwide and promotes knowledge dissemination in the field. Published in Data in Brief 2022.

projects.title: Johnson & Johnson Enterprise Financial Analytics Platform
projects.description: Engineered a comprehensive web-based financial and budget visualization dashboard for J&J's Business Intelligence team using Dash Plotly and RESTful APIs. The platform delivers real-time insights across therapeutic areas by integrating live data from Teradata and Denodo data lakes. Implemented secure Azure-based architecture with SharePoint integration, ensuring data confidentiality and compliance with corporate security standards while providing seamless access to financial metrics and KPIs.

projects.title: Multi-Language Command Exchange System for API Synchronization
projects.description: Built a sophisticated multi-language command exchange system integrating Python, MATLAB, and C# for seamless API synchronization and automation. This system enables real-time data exchange between different software platforms, streamlining workflows in research and development. The solution addresses the critical challenge of integrating heterogeneous systems in manufacturing environments, improving efficiency and reducing manual intervention.

projects.title: VR-Based Educational Platform for Pronunciation Training
projects.description: Developed and validated 10 interactive VR-based applications in Unity-3D for training and evaluating pronunciation skills in children aged 7–10. Successfully conducted field trials with 58 participants, achieving proof of concept validation. Built comprehensive automation libraries including text-to-speech conversion, animation creation, and VR synchronization. This innovative educational technology demonstrates the practical application of VR in skill development and assessment.

projects.title: MATLAB-Based Labeling Assistant Dashboard
projects.description: Developed an intelligent labeling assistant dashboard in MATLAB that streamlines database creation and assessment for machine learning projects. This tool increased efficiency by 10×, dramatically reducing manual labor in data annotation tasks. The dashboard features intuitive interfaces for rapid labeling, quality control mechanisms, and export functionality, making it an essential tool for ML dataset preparation.

publications.heading: Publications
publications.description: Peer-reviewed research publications in additive manufacturing, machine learning, computer vision, and autonomous systems

publications.title: Binocular Model: A deep learning solution for online temperature analysis using dual-wavelength Imaging Pyrometry
publications.abstract: This paper presents an innovative deep learning solution for online temperature analysis using dual-wavelength imaging pyrometry in metal additive manufacturing. The binocular model processes thermal data from multiple wavelengths simultaneously to provide highly accurate real-time temperature measurements, enabling precise thermal monitoring and quality control during the manufacturing process.

publications.title: Real-Time Print Tracking In Metal Additive Manufacturing Using Acoustic Emission Sensors And Vision Transformer Algorithms
publications.venue: ASME Manufacturing Science and Engineering Conference (MSEC)
publications.abstract: This work presents a Vision-Transformer-based motion tracking algorithm for interpreting acoustic emission data from robotic manipulator heads in metal additive manufacturing. The system achieves real-time tracking with ±0.1 mm accuracy, enabling precise monitoring and quality control during the manufacturing process through advanced transformer architectures.

publications.title: TDIP: Tunable Deep Image Processing, a Real Time Melt Pool Monitoring Solution
publications.venue: International Conference on Image Processing, Computer Vision, and Pattern Recognition (IPCV)
publications.abstract: TDIP presents a revolutionary tunable deep image processing framework for real-time melt pool monitoring in additive manufacturing. The system optimizes deep learning models to reduce processing time from 120 seconds to under 1 second, enabling instantaneous quality assessment and immediate corrective actions during manufacturing.

publications.title: Real-time monitoring and Gaussian process-based estimation of the melt pool profile in direct energy deposition
publications.venue: ASME Manufacturing Science and Engineering Conference (MSEC)
publications.abstract: This research presents a comprehensive approach to real-time monitoring and Gaussian process-based estimation of melt pool profiles in direct energy deposition additive manufacturing. The method combines statistical modeling with real-time sensor data to provide accurate predictions of melt pool geometry, enabling advanced process control.

publications.title: A deep learning solution for real-time quality assessment and control in additive manufacturing using point cloud data
publications.abstract: This work presents an AI-based application for real-time quality assessment using point cloud data in additive manufacturing. The deep learning solution achieves remarkable processing time reduction from 120 seconds to less than 1 second while maintaining high accuracy in defect detection, enabling real-time quality control during manufacturing.

publications.title: In-situ laser-based process monitoring and in-plane surface anomaly identification for additive manufacturing using point cloud and machine learning
publications.venue: ASME International Design Engineering Technical Conferences and Computers and Information in Engineering Conference (IDETC-CIE)
publications.abstract: This paper presents a comprehensive machine learning solution for in-situ laser-based process monitoring and in-plane surface anomaly identification in additive manufacturing. The system utilizes point cloud data and advanced ML techniques to detect surface defects during the manufacturing process with high accuracy.

publications.title: Sensory Data Fusion Using Machine Learning Methods For In-Situ Defect Registration In Additive Manufacturing: A Review
publications.venue: IEEE International Conference on Electro Information Technology (IEMTRONICS)
publications.abstract: This comprehensive review paper examines state-of-the-art sensory data fusion techniques using machine learning methods for in-situ defect registration in additive manufacturing. The work synthesizes current research trends and identifies future directions in smart manufacturing quality control.

publications.title: Image-based dataset of artifact surfaces fabricated by additive manufacturing with applications in machine learning
publications.abstract: This work presents a comprehensive, publicly accessible image-based dataset of artifact surfaces fabricated by additive manufacturing. The dataset includes thousands of high-quality annotated images designed specifically for machine learning applications, promoting research advancement and knowledge dissemination in smart manufacturing.
